page.title: 17FARMING (Sample) cont'd
page.content: (the first)cut of silage is taken for winter fodder. We make some hay as well in July. As well as cows we have 29 small lambs, 10 ewes and one ram. Some of these we sheared last week, mid-June. The fleeces are tied in bundles and taken to Antrim to the Ulster Wool Growers Association. We also have a dozen hens - the eggs are for family use. Daddy grows vegetables too, spring onions, potatoes and brussel sprouts. He sells these in Belfast Market. In summer we sell strawberries and in Autumn, plums and Bramley apples. Farming is a continuous job. Because of the milking the family seldom get a holiday all together: if we go away for a day trip we must hurry home.
